Package de.rwth.swc.coffee4j.junit

Annotation Type CombinatorialTest

  • @Target({ANNOTATION_TYPE,METHOD})
@Retention(RUNTIME)
@TestTemplate
@ExtendWith(de.rwth.swc.coffee4j.junit.CombinatorialTestExtension.class)
public @interface CombinatorialTest
    This annotation is used to mark a method which is a combinatorial test.

    To work with JUnit jupiter, the annotated method may not be private or static.

    A combinatorial test must specify a ModelProvider via a ModelSource or any composed annotation like ModelFromMethod. Optionally, configuration of the combinatorial test is also possible via a ConfigurationProvider using a ConfigurationSource. by default, a DelegatingConfigurationProvider will be used, but alternatively it is also possible to use custom configurations such as the ConfigurationFromMethod. All configurable aspects have sensible default. If only a InputParameterModel is specified, the combinatorial test will be executed with a Ipog, no fault characterization and execution reporter, and some default ArgumentConverter such as ParameterArgumentConverter ValueArgumentConverter TupleListArgumentConverter and CombinationArgumentConverter.

    Since an arbitrary number of parameters can be injected into the test method via definition of the InputParameterModel, a special order of parameters has to be preserved in the method. The following rules need to be followed:

    -zero or more normal parameters are declared first -followed by zero or more aggregators -followed by other parameters which are resolved by ParameterResolver not specific to combinatorial testing, for example another Extension.

    It is escpecially important that all normal parameters are declared in the same order as those in the InputParameterModel. Otherwise it will not work.

    CombinatorialTest may also be used as ameta-annotation in order to create a custom composed annotation which inherits the semantics of a CombinatorialTest.

    This type of test can not be used with junit-jupiter 5.3 parallel testing yet due to problems in the TestInputIterator. As such, it is marked with ExecutionMode.SAME_THREAD so that it is forcibly executed sequentially even if users use parallel testing in junit.

    This annotation is more or less a copy of the ParameterizedTest annotation provided in the junit-jupiter-params project.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      java.lang.String name
      Defines a custom display name for individual invocations of the CombinatorialTest.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        java.lang.String name
        Defines a custom display name for individual invocations of the CombinatorialTest. Should never be blank or consist of white spaces. This text is what is show in various IDEs to make a test identifiable to the user.

        Multiple placeholders are supported: -{index}: given the current invocation index of the test starting with 1 -{combination}: the complete Combination which is tested by the test -{PARAMETER_NAME}: the value of the Parameter with the given name in the currently tested Combination

        All placeholders are resolved using the CombinatorialTestNameFormatter.

        Returns:
        the name pattern for all test inputs in this CombinatorialTest
        Default:
        "[{index}] {combination}"
